name: Action, emotion and videogames
description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

key_work.title: Videogames supercut
key_work.brief_description: Today’s videogames focus as much on emotion as they do action. Through evolving technical expertise and the power of narrative, character and story are now as vital to a memorable gaming experience as ammo clips and power-ups.

constellations_primary.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_primary.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

start.title: Videogames supercut
start.brief_description: Today’s videogames focus as much on emotion as they do action. Through evolving technical expertise and the power of narrative, character and story are now as vital to a memorable gaming experience as ammo clips and power-ups.

constellations_primary.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_primary.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

end.title: The Last of Us Part II
end.creator_credit: Naughty Dog, Halley Wegryn Gross, Neil Druckmann, Anthony Newman and Kurt Margenau
end.brief_description: Five years after the events of The Last of Us, Ellie embarks on another journey through a post-apocalyptic America on a mission of vengeance against a mysterious militia.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

links.description: This videogame supercut demonstrates that emotion is just as important to contemporary videogames as action. One of the most prominent games to embody both is Naughty Dog’s acclaimed The Last of Us 2.

start.title: Bioshock Infinite
start.brief_description: This first-person follows Booker DeWitt as he enters the floating independent (formerly US) city of Columbia in 1912 and attempts to retrieve a girl trapped in a tower by the city’s self-proclaimed despot/prophet in order to erase his financial debt.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_other.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

end.title: Return of the Jedi
end.creator_credit: Howard G. Kazanjian, Rick McCallum, Nilo Rodis-Jamero, Lawrence Kasdan, Aggie Guerard Rodgers, James L. Schoppe, Richard Marquand, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Norman Reynolds, Fred Hole and Paul Huston

video_links.name: Return of the Jedi: Theatrical Trailer 1982
Return of the Jedi: Original Teaser Trailer (1982)

end.brief_description: Luke Skywalker leads a mission to rescue his friend Han Solo from the clutches of Jabba the Hutt, while the Emperor seeks to destroy the Rebellion once and for all with a second dreaded Death Star.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

links.description: In an alternate universe opened by the character Elizabeth in Bioshock Infinite, there is a Parisian cinema showing “La Revanche du Jedi”, French for “Revenge of the Jedi”, the working title of Return of the Jedi.

start.title: Return of the Jedi
start.creator_credit: Howard G. Kazanjian, Rick McCallum, Nilo Rodis-Jamero, Lawrence Kasdan, Aggie Guerard Rodgers, James L. Schoppe, Richard Marquand, Lucasfilm Ltd., 20th Century Fox, George Lucas, Norman Reynolds, Fred Hole and Paul Huston

start.brief_description: Luke Skywalker leads a mission to rescue his friend Han Solo from the clutches of Jabba the Hutt, while the Emperor seeks to destroy the Rebellion once and for all with a second dreaded Death Star.

end.title: The Mandalorian
end.creator_credit: John Bartnicki, Lucasfilm Ltd., Golem Creations, Fairview Entertainment, Doug Chiang, Shawna Trpcic and Andrew L. Jones

video_links.name: The Mandalorian | Official Trailer | Disney+ | Streaming Nov. 12
The Mandalorian | Season 2 Official Trailer | Disney+
The Mandalorian | Official Trailer 2 | Disney+ | Streaming Nov. 12

end.brief_description: After the fall of the Galactic Empire, lawlessness has spread throughout the galaxy. A lone gunfighter makes his way through the outer reaches, earning his keep as a bounty hunter.

constellations_other.name: Innovation, technology and design: Edweard Muybridge
constellations_other.description: A focus on the discovery, inspiration and innovation at the heart of moving image history

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Sound and cinema
constellations_other.description: Beginning with one of the first films to be screened at the Palais (a Melbourne cinema with its own outstanding resident orchestra) the constellation celebrates sound as an integral part of the connection between moving image work and audience.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

links.description: During the opening act of Return of the Jedi, fan favourite character Boba Fett is given a graceless goodbye when he hurtles into the mouth of the Sarlaac, where he stayed for over 20 years before reappearing in The Mandalorian, set five years after Return of the Jedi.

end.title: Star Wars Battlefront

video_links.name: Fighter Squadron Trailer
Reveal Trailer
E3 2015 Co-Op Missions Gameplay
Paris Games Week 2015 Trailer

end.brief_description: Star Wars: Battelfront allows players to blast or lightsabre their way through some of the most iconic battles from the Star Wars universe.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

links.description: Before The Mandalorian, Boba Fett did turn up a child in the prequels and in the Clone Wars show, but he was believed dead those 20 years. He also turned up in the videogame Star Wars: Battlefront, but it focused on action rather than narrative.

start.title: Westworld

video_links.name: Westworld - Official Trailer - Warner Bros. UK
Official Trailer

start.brief_description: A dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin, set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, Westworld explores a world in which every human appetite, noble or depraved, can be indulged.

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

end.title: Bioshock Infinite
end.brief_description: This first-person follows Booker DeWitt as he enters the floating independent (formerly US) city of Columbia in 1912 and attempts to retrieve a girl trapped in a tower by the city’s self-proclaimed despot/prophet in order to erase his financial debt.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_other.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

links.description: Open world videogames inspired Westworld, particularly Bioshock Infinite. When creator Ken Levine told Westworld creator Jonathan Nolan how much effort went into the dialogue for non-playable characters, Nolan saw humans tragically ignoring the AI personalities – something Westworld visitors do.

start.title: Bioshock Infinite
start.brief_description: This first-person follows Booker DeWitt as he enters the floating independent (formerly US) city of Columbia in 1912 and attempts to retrieve a girl trapped in a tower by the city’s self-proclaimed despot/prophet in order to erase his financial debt.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_other.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

end.title: Videogames supercut
end.brief_description: Today’s videogames focus as much on emotion as they do action. Through evolving technical expertise and the power of narrative, character and story are now as vital to a memorable gaming experience as ammo clips and power-ups.

constellations_primary.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_primary.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

links.description: Bioshock Infinite, like The Last of Us: Part 2, exemplifies how far videogames have come to include emotion and human elements in their far-fetched and fantastical stories. It’s also in the videogames supercut.

end.title: A Fistful of Dollars
end.creator_credit: Giorgio Papi, Arrigo Colombo, United Artists, Constantin Film, Jolly Film, Ocean Films, Sergio Leone, Akira Kurosawa, Víctor Andrés Catena, Jaime Comas Gil, Duccio Tessari, Ryûzô Kikushima, Fernando Di Leo and Tonino Valerii
end.brief_description: A Fistful of Dollars features Clint Eastwood’s first lead role in a film as the Man with No Name, the gun-slining anti-hero he played in Sergio Leone’s “Dollars Trilogy” of Spaghetti Western films.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

links.description: According to the original actor to play Boba Fett, Jeremy Bulloch, the cult favourite Star Wars character is based on Clint Eastwood’s anti-hero gunslinger, the Man with No Name, who first appeared in Sergio Leone’s A Fistful of Dollars.

start.title: The Last of Us Part II
start.creator_credit: Naughty Dog, Halley Wegryn Gross, Neil Druckmann, Anthony Newman and Kurt Margenau

constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

links.description: Videogames are becoming more like film and TV, with writers and actors turning up to work on games. Westworld actors Shannon Woodward and Jeffrey Wright both voice characters in The Last of Us 2, while writer Halley Gross was narrative lead for Part 2.
